website_summaries.verdict: A non-traditional trombone that works well for fun and practice. Great if you want to try out a trombone without spending a lot of money.
pros: Harder to damage than other trombones
Slide works well and is extremely tough
Includes plastic mouthpiece, but can be used with a metal mouthpiece
Fiberglass and brass slide with plastic bell
cons: The sound is not the same as brass
It plays well but just doesn't deliver the ring of brass

customer_reviews.title: For beginners only
customer_reviews.text: This instrument helps you get the idea of how playing a trombone is. It isn't a real trombone, though. E.G., I am able to play an F2 on the 1st position, a note that is not attainable playing a regular Bb tenor trombone. I am also able to bend down a note by a minor third, which shouldn't be possible. 2 years after purchasing it, the saliva going out of the water valve is still black (I bought a black pBone). The slide is still scratchy and gets harder to move after playing for 30 to 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: The best plastic trombone
customer_reviews.text: The pBone Jiggs Plastic Trombone is a quality product that is considered to be one of the best plastic trombones ever made. Manufactured in England. You clean it by washing it in the bathtub with soap and water. You lubricate the slide by spraying it with water as needed to keep it from sticking. You normally should have no problems with the slide sticking but if you do, then lubricate the slide with Yamaha's Trombone Slide Oil and after applying Yamaha's Trombone Slide Oil you will need to spray it down with water as needed to keep it from sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard J. Remillard

customer_reviews.title: Love this super-light orange trombone that sounds almost like a brass
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on the Jiggs P-bone for a few years and finally pulled the trigger. (Well, there's no trigger, if you know trombone terminology ;-) I love how light the t-bone is. And the sound is good. Not quite as good as my brass trombones, but so close that my family can't tell which one I'm playing unless they see it. I do use a metal mouthpiece instead of the plastic one that comes with it. Honestly,. most of the time when I want to practice or noodle, I just pick up the orange trombone. Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: It sounds great, the only thing I don't like is it will come loose sometimes
customer_reviews.text: For practice or for someone like me who just wanted to pick up a trombone and mess around again after years of not having one, it was a great deal. There is not a "screw" to join the two halves so I don't like that it can wiggle loose, but that's something I can live with for the value. You'd pay much more for a real one that doesn't do that. It really sounds amazingly good considering it's just plastic. I don't really notice a difference myself, but it's been 20 years since I played a brass one.
customer_reviews.author: user111

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: I played the Trombone for 10+ years from grade school to college and my brass T-bone has always had a broken spit valve that I had to close with a rubber band. I bought this bone because my sister got a trumpet and I thought it would be cool to play again with a fully functional T-bone. As soon as I got it, I started to play it and it sounded great! I knew it was working flawlessly because the dog started to go crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Dan W

customer_reviews.title: Great for a younger kid who wants to try it out.
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old was interested in learning trombone. I am a band director, so I tried him on a beginner horn I had but it was just too heavy for him right now. This has been a great alternative. It gets a good enough sound for him to figure out the basics. The sound is even better with a metal mouthpiece. If he decides to stick with the trombone, I will get him a “real” one when he starts school band. Right now he is thrilled to be able to play and has figured out sad trombone, twinkle and of course, the perfect dive bomb glissando.
customer_reviews.author: LSK

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was encouraged to get a plastic trombone by others in my band. We do some looong parades and I was assured I would feel a lot peppier carrying a plastic bone than lugging my brass one for almost five miles. True! The sound was surprisingly good - I wouldn't play it in the Philharmonic, but for marching music, it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: OCOzzie

customer_reviews.title: Haven't touched a trombone in 15 years, LOVIN IT
customer_reviews.text: I'm a grown man. I played trombone in middle school. Figured I wanted an instrument around the house. This purchase didn't disappoint. Good sound, the slide works real well. Was in pretty good Tune out of the box too. I've read that if you wanted to make the slide travel a bit better, consider using gun oil. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Daniil

customer_reviews.title: Wow! I love this trombone!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of online research before I bought this trombone. From what I learned, the pBone was one of the best, designed and sanctioned by British musicians. I made the right choice. This is an excellent horn, if we can remember that it's plastic and not very expensive. I use it for practice, mainly, but I just love the fact that it sounds almost like a euphonium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Far surpassed my hopes!!
customer_reviews.text: Friend had one growing up and I always wanted one of my own. Sounds awesome and pretty near standard trombones, even though it's made of plastic and not brass. Sounds super authentic. Color varieties are cool. Comes with a slim, soft case. Great for beginners or for practicing at home.
customer_reviews.author: T-Dog

customer_reviews.title: S0-so trombone to inexpensively find out if you want to play the trombone.
customer_reviews.text: The spit valve does not close reliably. This allows spit to dribble everywhere and allows air to leak when playing making the notes less pure. The slide does not move freely. I've used it daily for 3 months and it has not loosened up as the reviews said it would. The smallest amount of spit on the slide makes the situation much worse.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: its great
customer_reviews.text: this for a test trombone i got its way better then i thought just don't drop it and hit the slide on the ground it will break the lock over all its great. it sounds like a trombone feels like a trombone and it does not require a lot of effort to put together and take apart it does not stick the mouth piece is very good. for a beginner trombone its perfect and especially for 9 through 20 year olds maybe its just great.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Darker colors than what the photo shows
customer_reviews.text: Good sound for something made out of plastic. I used to be hardcore into trombone playing. Now I play occasionally but I find that I'm more likely to play when I have my plastic one right there ready to go. Meanwhile my $2000 concert trombone is in storage. But it keeps my chops up. A junior high kid won't feel the difference in quality. So i would recommend this to any beginner. Watch out about the colors... They are darker than they appear in the photos. I first bought a blue (but returned it bc it looked purple.) I now have the green (it's a very dark forest green.)
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great choice
customer_reviews.text: My son (5.5) is very happy with this. It gives him a sense of real instrument ownership without any pressure or concern of “OMG don’t drop it!” He gets a nice tone out of it, and when and if he wants to play something real or take a first lesson someday, we know we have a nice affordable instrument already in hand. The color is delightful as well. Very glad to have this.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer D. Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Great trombone, especially for a beginner or for traveling
customer_reviews.text: Got one because my dad had one and I wanted to learn trombone. You can't beat the price and you really can't hear much of a difference in sound quality, especially when played by an experienced musician. I have had no issues with the slide sticking or any other mechanical issues, and it is always a conversation starter with any friends when they see it or you tell them about your plastic trombone. (Mine is also red which helps)
customer_reviews.author: Jim Harris

customer_reviews.title: Missing mouthpiece but fun plastic trombone
customer_reviews.text: The trombone is a fun plastic version. However, ours did not come with the listed 2 mouthpieces. Contact with the seller led to an offer of a $10refund that never materialized. Disappointed in this purchase & experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Company reships returned- defective product. Mine was labeled "SQUEAKS" ...
customer_reviews.text: Company reships returned- defective product. Mine was labeled "SQUEAKS" tag, and they re-shipped it to us anyway. Buy, from someone else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dever

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great!
customer_reviews.text: This sounds amazing even though it’s plastic. It’s light enough for my 5 year old to hold and play on her own. Her favorite color is purple and she’s been asking for a purple trombone so we decided to see if there was one, and low and behold! Our son now wants a blue one. We will be buying him one when he turns 5!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah F Johnson

customer_reviews.title: An amazing horn considering...
customer_reviews.text: Have logged only a few minutes on this pBone...it's amazing, considering I'm not that easily impressed! I used the included plastic mouthpiece; i wonder what my brass mouthpiece will play like on this. I could see using it on a gig. The only caveat is that it plays in a 'stuffy' manner, but this is no surprised in that it won't vibrate like metal does. But hey, just clip a wireless mic to the bell and your good to go. Also, this thing weighs 1/2 to 2/3 less than its brass counterpart. Way to go, Jiggs!
customer_reviews.author: Steve R. Ferrier

customer_reviews.title: Sick
customer_reviews.text: I played trombone for 9 years in school and couldn't afford to buy a professional model when I graduated since I wasn't pursuing a professional career. Five years later I came across this. For my uses this bad boy is more than perfect. Sound AMAZING considering that it is made of plastic, I was shocked by the quality of tone. Not quite brass, but only a trombone player will know that. Durable plastic, and so far so good. I gave it a nice custom look with vinyl decals and it fits my standard Bach 6 1/2 AL mouthpiece.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Sounds just like a trombone
customer_reviews.text: I have played trombone since I was 10 and wanted to get back to playing it after graduating college. Sounded just like a regular trombone. The only thing I would suggest is getting a metal trombone mouthpiece for better sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Better than you would think
customer_reviews.text: When my son asked me for a p-bone for Christmas I was pretty skeptical and started reading reviews. For a plastic trombone, the sound isn't that bad, although I would recommend using the regular mouthpiece like some of the experts suggested for better tone quality. The only small problem we have with it is that the tuning slide doesn't always stay put and needs more frequent adjustments. From the parent prospective, I would much rather have him take the p-bone to pep band at ball games so the Jupiter doesn't get banged around while teenage boys are being teenage boys. I would recommend the p-bone for this type of use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Bohman

customer_reviews.title: Terrific for band students!
customer_reviews.text: My 11 yr old grandson wants to continue playing in the school band now that he can practice at home on this white trombone.. He can't bring the school trombone home easily, so I bought him this one and he ( and the band director) are very happy! The sound is surprisingly good and he's excited about band again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's fun. It's not going to sound exactly like brass
customer_reviews.text: It's fun. It's not going to sound exactly like brass; but it's going to fill a void if you need to practice for not a lot of money. I'm not going to be playing professionally; but I have seen one of these up on stage with Bomb the Music Industry and it was able to cut through a live sound mix of their brand of ska.
customer_reviews.author: LordGunhand

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: When my daughter originally told me she wanted to play trombone in her 4th grade band I had flashbacks to my experience playing the trombone as a kid and having to lug a case that was nearly as tall as i was through the halls. Then i discovered this trombone and I couldnt be happier with the purchase. Its very lightweight and comes with a very convenient carrying bag so she is able to take it to school without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: kevin david

customer_reviews.title: pBone!  Yes for beginners!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a music teacher. My brass playing music teacher friends have been raving about this. Our music program is short on instruments this year, so my Booster Club bought this for me. It weighs 1.8 pounds, comes in a great over-the-shoulder strap bag and for me and beginning trombone players, it's a great way to start on this wonderful instrument! It really would be a good enough instrument for any beginning - probably for the first 3 or more years. It's fun!
customer_reviews.author: PattyP23

customer_reviews.title: Just Too Cool!
customer_reviews.text: I am a music teacher who now owns one of each of the instruments I teach. The pBone is perfect for me. It is lightweight, sounds great (with even my limited skill level) and the kids think it is super cool. Three of us music teachers in my district have one now (red, green and purple) and we are looking forward to playing pBone trios! The sound of a plastic trombone is not ever going to match brass, but for my purposes it is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this horn mostly out of curiosity and was surprised by how good it actually sounds. The first thing I noticed was the weight. It's extremely light. In fact it feels like somethings missing when you pick it up in the case. Even the mouthpiece is plastic. After tooting a few notes on it, I had to laugh at how much it sounds like a metal trombone! I'll probably end up giving this to a young trombone player to use in school, but it could also be used as a practice horn because of its durability.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H.

customer_reviews.title: It was easy to set up and she starting playing it right ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to help with practicing. She has a regular brass trombone, but lugging it to school and back on the bus is a pain. This trombone arrived tonight. It was easy to set up and she starting playing it right away. Sound great for a plastic trombone and is fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: You have to work the slide a bit with constant cleaning but once you've cleaned up enough carbon fiber shavings off the inside i
customer_reviews.text: Haven't played in over 5 years. Saw this read the reviews and bought it as a novelty. WORTH EVERY CENT, definitely not a NOVELTY. You have to work the slide a bit with constant cleaning but once you've cleaned up enough carbon fiber shavings off the inside it works like new. I wouldn't recommend to use this in a band or jazz ensemble until you have THOROUGHLY cleaned the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Reyes

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!!!!! FUN for the ones who wait.
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING!! So much fun!! I play many many instruments; this was my first "brass", though. In a month I can already play easy songs. But I already feel I need classes right away. It took FOREVER to get in Manaus, much more than Amazon said, even with brazilian post office right in time as they usually plan and work. Instrument constitution is great, sounds great, just as I researched all around. Easy to assemble, to clean, to let your friends try, to carry around... JUST BUY IT! lol Lots of fun. :) I Started with "Se a canoa não virar", Now playing "2001 Space Odissey" (or 'Also Sprach Zaratustra' by Strauss), funky version by Eumir Deodato.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo Cardoso Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how good this sounds for a plastic horn. Grant it, I've only had it for a day, but as of right now I love it. The slide takes a little getting used to but it gets better the more you use it. Of course a high end brass horn is going to sound better, but this is a fine little horn for pep band or to take along on a trip. and you're not paying 1,000$ + for it. Over all, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna M. Newman

customer_reviews.title: My 1st chair trombonist LOVES It!
customer_reviews.text: She doesn't put it down. Easy to carry all over the house, up and down stairs. Very clean sound. And it's Purple, what 16 year old wouldn't love that!
customer_reviews.author: T Ell

customer_reviews.title: It's plastic, but serves a purpose well
customer_reviews.text: It is a plastic trombone. If you are expecting to sound like a professional, you probably won't (and if you were a professional, you'd likely be playing on a much better quality instrument anyway). However, this has its role. It doesn't sound too bad, and you can develop reasonable technique. It is a better option than Chinese "Instrument Shaped Objects" of similar price but are very poorly constructed. For a beginner starting out, or someone testing to see if the trombone is good for them, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Stearman

customer_reviews.title: bought this so my son could leave his expensive nice trombone at school and practice at home on this ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this so my son could leave his expensive nice trombone at school and practice at home on this one, and not have to carry the heavy one around. This one is designed by professionals and is very good sounding. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: brandi

customer_reviews.title: this is a fun instrument for a trombone player to have laying around ...
customer_reviews.text: for price and plastic, this is a fun instrument for a trombone player to have laying around for occasional play
customer_reviews.author: Marg G

customer_reviews.title: Great practice trombone
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pBone I’ve bought for my son because we’ve been happy with the first one. (The reason for buying a second one is so that he can have one at my house and one at his mom’s house.) He can leave his standard trombone at school and practice at home with these. He does say it plays a little different than the standard trombone, but not enough that it doesn’t work for practice. I’m probably not the best person to judge the sound, but to my ear it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great as a practice instrument
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in her junior high band and this is an affordable option for at home practice. She is able to keep her brass instrument at school and doesn’t have to drag it back and forth to school every day.
customer_reviews.author: JB Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: The pbone trombone arrived very timely. This is the perfect for my 5th grader because I don't have to worry about getting dents like a brass instrument. Also, it is very lightweight in comparison to a brass trombone and sounds very similar.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Bwaaaaaaaaamp!
customer_reviews.text: It's plastic. It's fun colored. It seems well made, but time will have to reveal that. Bought it for my teenage son. It sounds like a normal trombone. I'm impressed. The purple will add a little fun to pep and marching band.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy T.

customer_reviews.title: Fun alternative
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight yet surprisingly sturdy. Slide is a bit sticky out of the box but gets much smoother with use. Don't bother using the plastic mouthpiece that comes with it, invest in an actual trombone mouthpiece. The tone and playability improves dramatically when using a real mouthpiece. For what it is, glorified pvc pipe, it's amazing! Real trombone tone (when using real mouthpiece) that sounds pretty close to a metal horn (with some obvious tonal limitations due to the materials) at a fraction of the cost/weight of a brass horn. Won't replace my pro horn, but a fun, economical and lightweight alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Damon P.

customer_reviews.title: plays great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try playing again. I wanted to get a cheap instrument that plays good. I chose this product as it is in the lower price range of trombones. It is extremely light and portable. I really like it. I would suggest getting a brass mouthpiece. The plastic mouthpiece plays ok, but just doesn't feel right to me. The sound is great though. I think it sounds just fine. I think this would be an excellent first instrument or just something to haul around for a quick gig.
customer_reviews.author: blueskies

customer_reviews.title: Fun. Amazes people with its sound!
customer_reviews.text: You can buy a brass trombone cheaper, but it won't be as light or as fun as this! I got black, because I've always wanted a black trombone, and have been happy with it. Even more fun would be to be able to order different colored bell or slide! Our middle school band director won't allow my son to use a Pbone, which is disappointing, because it would be much better for playing at football games!
customer_reviews.author: GadgetFanatic

customer_reviews.title: Hey, it works!
customer_reviews.text: While I cannot recommend this as a concert instrument, it plays, and the sound is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur trombonist have been playing the trombone in concert bands and orchestra close to 30 years, and have always been looking for a convenient alternative that I can bring to parties. The sound is 'real' and clear, and the slide is well made. You might want to put some slide o'mix on the slide, as it is initially a bit cumbersome in the far positions, but it will eventually wear into a nice smooth condition even without it. Your small-bore mouthpiece will fit if you want a little more robust sound for recordings or semi-serious performances, but the attached plastic mouthpiece (same color as the trombone itself) is good enough for casual playing.
customer_reviews.author: hamagurimarch

customer_reviews.title: Light, Fun and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners and for cold playing. It’s super light weight and easy to play. At first the slide is rough but the more you play it the easier it slides. The tone is a little poor only due to the fact it’s plastic. Again it’s perfect for a beginner or in the cold but I wouldn’t use it for anything other than “fun” songs
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: good quality if you are looking for something cheap before ...
customer_reviews.text: Got what I expected, good quality if you are looking for something cheap before you buy the expensive stuff for your kids who are just starting out in band
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Great Substitute
customer_reviews.text: My son was in the college band and graduated. Some of the bone players had these and he got a good review from one of them about these plastic trombones. Although not quite as dynamic as a regular trombone it was a great gift that he is enjoying. He anticipates playing with the community band!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Plastic but not a toy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad, a professional trombone player in a Dixieland band. He thought it was funny until he started playing it and his pals started asking where they could get one. Light, good tone, and you don't have to worry about it in the rain like you do your expensive horn. I wouldn't recommend it for your only instrument, but as an additional weapon in your arsenal. If they had had this kind of stuff when I was in the high school marching band...oh wait, I played sax.
customer_reviews.author: Just John

customer_reviews.title: Better than a rental and worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This came highly recommended by my sons trombone teacher. It's nice and light, so he can walk with it in band.
customer_reviews.author: Joanzino

customer_reviews.title: Tlsounds pretty close to a brass trombone
customer_reviews.text: Tlsounds pretty close to a brass trombone, much lighter which is great for marching band. Has broken twice just this football season (4 home games, used twice) inner slide came loose and mouth piece broke in half.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oh, right.. I bought a pBone. ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh, right . . I bought a pBone . . . and still looking for an application for it . . . beyond teaching, of course. I have noticed that an 'alternatively abled' student with strength issues finds it much easier to hold up his pBone than his metal horn.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Moore

customer_reviews.title: held up great and sounds amazing for a plastic instrument
customer_reviews.text: Used for performance in several shows, held up great and sounds amazing for a plastic instrument! Be thoughtful of how you want to lubricate the slide. I ended up using a decent amount of cold cream with occasional water spritzes.
customer_reviews.author: Kip McCharen

customer_reviews.title: pBone Rocks it.
customer_reviews.text: This pBone is great for beginners. Lightweight, easy to maintain, and has a great sound in all but the really high ranges. And the price is fantastic. I would have already paid the cost of this trombone in rental fees and my daughter has only had it for 3 months. Great buy and great instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great trombone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 4 year old as he requested it from Santa and Santa's toy shop doesn't seem to have any toy trombones - I searched EVERYWHERE. I didn't have expectations that he'd be able to make any sounds, but he really did! It's also VERY light weight so even though it's taller than he is, he can lift it with no problem. Very easy to assemble and the cool colors also make it lots of fun. Guess we have to do lessons next!
customer_reviews.author: YM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great grift for my Grandson the plastic sounds just like brass . Plays it in the bath tub.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ham

customer_reviews.title: This is a great instrument. The price vs quality is unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great instrument. The price vs quality is unbelievable. My son is a thrasher to anything that has a value of $50 and higher. Clothes, devices, rx glasses, they just fall apart in his hands. Not this pBone, its thrasher proof, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New to the Trombone
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the trombone and with this one I feel like I can learn well with it. The tone is great and my brief experience says that I should learn it well it I just practice
customer_reviews.author: Daniel King, EdD

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: This Bone really sounds nice. Very impressive. My son is a music major and has 2 custom trombones already and wanted one of these for the novelty of it. We are both shocked at the sound that comes out of this plastic horn.
customer_reviews.author: MrLittlejohn

customer_reviews.title: Two defects on one we received
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son for practice while away from home. Pros: Light weight, durable, cool looking, low price. Cons: Slide action poor and noisy, two leaks. Water key is not water tight, slinging spit while playing. Tested the outer slide in a sink and found leaks from both the water key and from the joint where the slide and green u-tube at the end of the slide meet. Harder to play wide range of notes compared to an old brass trombone we have; may be due to above defects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is nice for my son to practice at home when he has to leave his trombone at school.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Love this trombone
customer_reviews.text: This trombone is fun to play, super lightweight, and is one of the best bone-for-the-buck purchases ever! I bring it to gigs & don't have to worry about the bell or slide getting dented. It did take some doing to get the slide to ease up, but persistence pays off, the slide does get easier over time. Awesome purchase, I really enjoy playing this trombone.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: a Real Eye-Catcher
customer_reviews.text: Great instrument! Plays fantastic and catches everyone's eye! If you're a trombone player, this is a must have. It's cheap and simply fantastic when it comes down to it. I would recommend this to any kind of musician who wants to get a trombone.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Claxton

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Horn plays very well and is superior to some other plastic trombones I've tried, with better tone and sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: P. M. Culpepper Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, great for a fun instrument to mess around with, looks good in white, over all great buy👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Nice trombone, plays just fine, very light and easy to hold, slide action is smooth with no lube. I like it!
customer_reviews.author: York

customer_reviews.title: Great trombone. Very light, good sound.
customer_reviews.text: My oldest son picked it up and started playing it right away. He hadn't played trombone in 2 years or so, loved this lightweight version. Says it sounds almost as good as the brass version. I am happy he is reacquainting himself with this (he plays guitar these days). Love it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveK

customer_reviews.title: Decent and Dingless
customer_reviews.text: Sounds is quite decent. slide is surprisingly light. Kids dropped it right away and no damage. Only con is that I feel the slide doesn't quite wedge into the bell portion as cleanly as I'd like, but that is minor. I am glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Marlon R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: it is a great option when traveling or as a backup horn
customer_reviews.text: The Pbone arrived on time, and was exactly as advertised. I took it on a camping trip and played it everyday to keep my chops in shape. The slide requires some breaking in and it helps to clean it every few days. Although not a substitute for a real brass trombone, it is a great option when traveling or as a backup horn. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: trevor long

customer_reviews.title: Switched from Trumpet
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to handle. Slide works smoothly, no drag. Prefer a brass (Yamaha or Bach) mouthpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner instrument
customer_reviews.text: My son is enjoying his new instrument, he is just beginning to learn to play. This instrument is nice because you don't need to do much to maintain it, other than wipe the slide dry after each use. Several experienced players have used it and commented that it sounds much better than expected. It doesn't have quite the same amount of resonance as a brass, but then again it didn't cost $1000 either. This was about the same price as renting an instrument from the school for a year. Also if he loses this we don't owe the school $1000.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size ..I feared it would be small .. I'm a grown man 300 pds still fits me.. horn plays a hair sharp so tuning slide is pulled out nice amount.. if u have big hands the slide may bite when arriving to first position.. beautiful horn tho
customer_reviews.author: Macman

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a Shiny two thousand dollar Bach Trombone, this ain't it. But if you want something fun to play that can go anywhere and is durable and with surprisingly good sound... for very little money... THIS IS IT.
customer_reviews.author: Theatre Buff

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Not the best trombone in the world, but it's great that you can get a good trombone for this price point. Sounds so much like a brass one, I wouldn't know the difference (probably because I'm a trumpet player). 5 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hallacher

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting back into the groove
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sounding instrument. Certainly better tone than my old student horn.
customer_reviews.author: J. Breckenridge

customer_reviews.title: Great Trombone
customer_reviews.text: good value...wish case had a zippered pouch for mouthpiece. I prefer my original metal mouthpiece but can't carry it in th pbone bag because pouch not zippered. item as advertised. Slide smoothes out after a few hours use.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Commodore

customer_reviews.title: This pBone is fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Our son has used his plastic trombone to play in pep bands in high school and college, so it has seen a lot of use over the years. We would highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Val G Collins

customer_reviews.title: Wow. I got this for my nephew, who ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I got this for my nephew, who wanted it for his birthday, not expecting much for sound quality. I was surprised at how close the sound is to a real brass instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound.  Slide take time to break in
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help get myself back in to music.For the price it sounds pretty good. The slide works great when it's dry but as condensation builds it becomes slower. The more I use it the better the slide gets.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: No problems
customer_reviews.text: No packaging issues. Everthing was what we expected and the kids like it. We got this for a petite 12 yr old girl that currently plays the tuba, and we are trying to lure her into playing something she can move by herself.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great! Got it for my 4 yr old boy. It is tough and sturdy and has a good trombone sound. I didn't want him bending up a brass one. I might buy one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Tim in Pennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: pBone - great for Marching Band
customer_reviews.text: I first heard someone playing a pBone two years ago. Admittedly she was an excellent musician - but I was surprised how good the sound was. Last summer I used a friend's pBone during a parade and it was so light. My pBone has lived up to my expectations. It is light and easy to use. I do need to use a lyre that clips to the bell - but that's holding up so far.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great instrument for the price. Ain’t brass. But you knew that
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, amazingly good sound
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my daughter who loves the light weight, its ability to take abuse, and for its overall portability. It also has a very good sound, especially since it's plastic.
customer_reviews.author: JeffreyDJ

customer_reviews.title: The blue is such a pretty color. It sounds great too
customer_reviews.text: This helps so he won't have to carry his big trombone back and forth from school. The blue is such a pretty color. It sounds great too.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I am a retired band director whose instrument is trombone. My 13 year-old grandson is a third generation trombone player and I thought this would be great for marching band. When it arrived I played it for a couple hours and found it to be quite remarkable as to tone, response and intonation. Highly recommended as a backup piece or for marching or pep band situations.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schrimpf

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. It sounds so authentic to me. The slide moves so smoothly and I can adjust the tunning so well, it like I just bought a new meatal trombrone.It is definatly a great alternative to a real one. Though I am replacing the not-so-good plastic mouthpeice with a metal one. It sounds better. I totaly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Looks good sounds great awesome for someone begining trombone and not trying to spend a heep on a nice nice trombone yet
customer_reviews.author: Samrainbowheart

customer_reviews.title: ... a gift to my grandson and he is very happy with
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my grandson and he is very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Nankin

customer_reviews.title: it's a bargain
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. The best is that it is very lightweight so can be easily carried anywhere. Sound for a beginner not as good as one who is accomplished player, but it's still a good value, and fun.
customer_reviews.author: tak

customer_reviews.title: pBones rock and rule!
customer_reviews.text: While it's not as good as "the real thing", it still holds its own when used outdoors (especially when you're not sure of the weather) and where you can't be sure of taking really good care of a good brass instrument. Our concert band now sports three of these p-Bones (soon to be four, maybe five) and they proved to be really appropriate for our community Christmas carols gigs this year. pBones rock and rule!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Weller

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive starter, in whatever colors your passion.
customer_reviews.text: Very inexpensive. Albeit you do sacrifice tone and resonance. Super light weight, easy to carry and play for smaller framed kids.
customer_reviews.author: ADSandvig

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this for Christmas and he loves it. Says it sounds very nice for being plastic. We do highly recommend getting a good metal mouthpiece for it.
customer_reviews.author: fbmom

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want it for.
customer_reviews.text: The entire band at my high school pooled together money to buy this pBone for our band director, and we all signed it, and it has worked out great! I am thrilled to present it to him in May at our final band trip. While the tone quality isn't great, and no serious trombonist should use tho as their primary instrument, it is fun to have at home and to play around on.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Watt

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as it was described. I received it within a few days. I was very happy with everything. I bought it for my son who is a junior in high school and it is much easier for him to transport back and forth to school. The band teacher also has one and has bought several for the school. It is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee D

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This horn is great. Not as good as a brass horn but for the price you can not go wrong. My son like to use it for marching band because it is so light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Im a student. I chose it to keep my embrochure flexible because I play the Shofar but I'm getting a lot more from it than I expected. I'm beginning to get good sound and enjoyment out of it. Also, and it's very important, in Puerto Rico we have several cultural customs in playing outdoors, visiting people in diverse settings and it's light construction is a definite plus for this. I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: Arnaldo Soto-Felix

customer_reviews.title: It has a wonderful sound, is easy to transport
customer_reviews.text: My 16 year old son loves this trombone! It has a wonderful sound, is easy to transport, and looks cool (according to him ;))
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hinson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the pbone for my daughter who is in the highscool marching band. Her section has almost 20 "boners" and while in the stands they get the crowds rowled up by doing what they call Suicides. Using the brass for this got expensive. Even if my daughter didn't make a mistake, someone else's mistake could cost big$$$. Most of the section bought these and now they don't have to worry about hurting their $1000 plus instruments. Huge relief to parents!!!!
customer_reviews.author: shellalaska

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great--and weighs next to nothing!
customer_reviews.text: I received the trombone and tried it out at a gig. I play primarily bass trombone which can be tiring after a couple of hours. What a relief to put it down and play the pbone for a tune or two. The slide was a bit tight. The instructions said it would work itself out over time but that a little oil would help. I hate to wait so I tried the oil. Still not quite smooth, but it has been improving. And the sound is virtually indistinguishable from a traditional horn. Also a definite conversation starter.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in Toledo

product_meta.title: pInstrument Plastic pBone Trombone - Mouthpieces and Carrying Bag - Bb Authentic Sound for Student & Beginner - Durable ABS Construction - Blue
product_meta.description: Color:BlueThe Jiggs Whigham pBone brings a fun and intriguing twist to the traditional trombone. With its plastic construction, this lightweight instrument sounds remarkably like typical brass trombones. The pBone features a .500-inch bore design with an ergonomic grip for comfort and an overall weight of only 1.8 pounds. The pBone features a fiberglass slide with brass slide stockings on the inner hand slide to keep the slide moving freely. The hand slide with feel smoother the more you play the instrument, and you can even play the instrument without the need for slide lubrication. The Jiggs pBone includes a plastic mouthpiece and carrying bag and is available in various colors.
feature_bullets: MUSIC TRANSFORMS: The affordable pBone plastic trombone in energizing colors is as fun as it is functional! A standard .500 bore pitched in Bb creates an authentic rich lower sound like its brass-playing equivalent. Great for musicians at any level!

LIGHTWEIGHT: Half the weight of a brass trombone, the pBone is easy to play and hold resulting in good form and allowing an enjoyable practice or lesson. The ergonomic grip is perfect for hands of any size making it a student’s go-to musical instrument.

QUICK ASSEMBLY: Maintenance free! The pBone has a unique antimicrobial design and works straight out of the box! Includes two mouthpieces and a fabric carrying case which provides safe storage and is easy to carry to school or lessons.

TRUSTED QUALITY: Designed by award-winning musicians, the eco-friendly virtually indestructible trombone is for kids from beginner to intermediate levels! Creates an authentic robust sound approved by Music Teachers. Fully sustainable and recyclable.

ENJOY FREE-LESSONS: Committed to music and learning, your order provides access to fun backing tracks, our Customer Support Team and other online resources! Order your trombone in your school color and start playing music today!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars572 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
